meanings.definition: Apply fresh lubricant to (something) to make it work smoothly.
meanings.sent1: He relubricates the gears in his bike to keep them running quietly.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic relubricates the engine to ensure it runs smoothly.
meanings.sent3: She relubricates the squeaky door hinges, making them silent like a ninja.
meanings.sent4: The new oil relubricates the machine, breathing life back into it.
meanings.sent5: With a few drops, he relubricates the rusty lock, unlocking it effortlessly.

meanings.definition: Add lubricant to (something) to prevent wear and tear.
meanings.sent1: To extend the life of the bearings, he relubricates them regularly.
meanings.sent2: The maintenance crew relubricates the conveyor belt to avoid friction.
meanings.sent3: The robot relubricates its joints, ensuring it stays flexible and agile.
meanings.sent4: She relubricates the hinges on the gate, keeping them from rusting.
meanings.sent5: Regularly relubricating the chains on the bike prevents them from breaking.
